snippet: A generation of geriatric gangsters known as the “oldfellas” can be found in court displaying catheter bags or discussing the state of their kidneys in hopes that a judge will agree to a short sentence.
abstract: Federal District Court in Brooklyn has been filled in recent years with Mafiosi on trial for crimes committed in 1970s and '80s, when Mafia loomed larger than it does today; informers are more common due to variety of factors, allowing prosecutors to pursue cases against people like Thomas DiFiore, highest-ranking member of Bonanno crime family; many defendants try to use age and infirmity in pleading for lenient sentencing.
lead_paragraph: A generation of geriatric gangsters known as the “oldfellas” can be found in court displaying catheter bags or discussing the state of their kidneys in hopes that a judge will agree to a short sentence.

headline.main: Before Judges, the Godfathers Become Sick Old Grandfathers
headline.print_headline: At Sentencing, the Godfathers Become Sick Old Grandfathers
